column4: Whenever Xorg tries to run, my system freezes up and my screen is covered with graphical garbage.
why do you want to do that ?
Xorg is giving me problems.
why re-install then unless you have deleted components
Basically, whwnever it tries to run, my screen fills up with garbage and my inputs are nonresponsive.
what video card do you have ?
I may have corrupted components, is my thought. Uh, lemme think...
Diamond Radeon 9550.
why may you have corrupted components
what makes you think that ?
Well, I don't know what else to do.
ok - so lets look at it logcically
first thing to do is try the vesa xorg driver, have you done that yet ?
I've never even  heard of that, nor am I entirely certain HOW to "try" the vesa xorg driver.
that's fine - just checking I'm not wasting your time
My expertise with unix extends to running the commands I read on man pages. :D
in the file "/etc/X11/xorg.conf" you'll have a very limited set of information
Alright, once I have that information, then what?
look for a section "device" with an identifier that is your video card
ok - in that section add the line Driver "vesa"
Just add it? Alright, will do, and will report back.
driver <space> "vesa"
